thread.title: Paddy McGuinness gatecrashes Good Morning Britain LIVE - and insults Piers Morgan
thread.title_full: Paddy McGuinness gatecrashes Good Morning Britain LIVE - and insults Piers Morgan

author: Kyle O'Sullivan
title: Paddy McGuinness gatecrashes Good Morning Britain LIVE - and insults Piers Morgan
text:
Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Paddy McGuinness invaded the Good Morning Britain studio this morning to the bemusement of its hosts. 
The Take Me Out host pushed a trolley full of cakes in while wearing an apron to give fundraising ideas for Comic Relief. 
Ben Shephard and Kate Garraway were stunned as Paddy questioned if the show had started, despite interrupting Richard Arnold's entertainment section. 
A confused Kate screamed: "What are you doing here?" Read More Paddy burst onto the screen with a tray full of massive cakes (Photo: ITV) Ben and Kate couldn't believe what they were seeing (Photo: ITV) 
"Second time in twenty years I've been on breakfast TV," said Paddy, who was raising awareness for Red Nose Day on the 24th of March. 
"Its better without Piers isn't it, more relaxed." 
The Max and Paddy star then went over to give Kate a kiss, claiming he could "still smell the gin from last night" after she enjoyed boozy celebrations following the launch of her first novel, The Joy of Big Knickers. Read More Here's why you might be seeing a whole lot more of Paddy McGuinness on the telly Paddy thought he could smell booze on Kate (Photo: ITV) 
After hugging Ben and Richard, Paddy proceeded to offer everyone a slice of cake, without caring that a live show was going on. 
Paddy said: "That's the good thing about breakfast TV, no one is watching. This will be our little secret." 
He then produced a written list of fundraising ideas, including 'bake a difference' and a 'sponsored stay silent'. The Take Me Out host gave viewers some fundraising ideas (Photo: ITV) 
Paddy admitted that he would be "eating cakes" for the big day, while Kate spilled the secret that he would be cropping up on lots of other daytime shows throughout the day. 
"I am appearing on daytime TV. I've just caught a glimpse of myself on the TV and this is not a good look in the morning," said Paddy. 
"Kate you've spoiled the secret, I am not appearing on Loose Women today. 
"I'm definitely not singing Gloria Gaynor 'I will survive'." Richard couldn't continue his chat about the entertainment news (Photo: ITV) 
After a quick selfie, Paddy eventually let the hosts get back to the show, but not before disrupting Laura Tobin's weather report. 
Kate added: "It's brilliant when nobody tells you what's going on on your own show." 
Viewers took to Twitter to praise Paddy's chaotic appearance on the show. Viewers couldn't get enough of Paddy's strange appearance (Photo: ITV) 
One fan said: "Paddy will have just doubled the views that #gmb get when @piersmorgan is on" 
Another added: "Love @PaddyMcGuinness gate crashing.. get the cake away from @kategarraway this could get dangerous @benshephard @GMB" 
A third said: "@GMB one day poor #RichardArnold will get to do an uninterrupted segment.. good job this was for charity though #RedNoseDay" Like us on Facebook
